page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Three generations ago 37.5% men and 67% working wives worked less than 1 mile from home. 38% men and 25% working wives travelled between 1 and 5 miles and only 4% men travelled over 10 miles from home. One generation later the largest proportion of men and working wives travelled between 5 and 10 miles. A small group travelled over 30 miles. Now most fathers travel between 10 and 30 miles and 75% go by car. 51.5% of working mothers travel between 1 and 10 miles, but a large group live less than 1 mile from work. People like to live in the area and don't mind how far they have to travel to work.
